subject: No assertEquals(double, double)?
msgSnippet: I was writing a testcase, and realized that with all the assertion methods in junit.framework.Assert, there is no assertEquals(double, double). There are
messageBody:
I was writing a testcase, and realized that with all the assertion
methods
in junit.framework.Assert, there is no assertEquals(double, double).
There
are versions for integers, longs, shorts, chars, Obejcts, etc. Is this
just
an oversight?

I like the assertEquals(XXXX, XXXX) methods because they create a
meaningful
string if the test fails. Otherwise, I have to create the string myself
:(


"They that give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety
deserve neither liberty nor safety."
- Benjamin Franklin
